events.comment: Destroy enemies and powerups when they get too far offscreen.

The CollisionProbe is an object that gets moved around and resized to perform more specific collision checks around objects. Other people typically handle this with "detector" objects, but I find that messy.

sub-events.comment: Super Mario Bros had a grand total of 3 repeating background options (and 1 blank) for all of its levels. Why place those objects over and over again when the computer can do it for you?
Mario has various ways of entering a level. Some are defined by the level, others are defined by what mario was doing prior.
Rise out of a pipe. The positioning is very specific to the level design of the original game. Not recommended for copying into your own game.
Stop rising out of a pipe.
Create appropriate mario sprite depending on his current powerup.
Set Mario's max speed and acceleration, depending on whether the run button is held.
Allow the run button to be released briefly without affecting speed, so the player can shoot off a fireball running full tilt.
Increase acceleration when Mario is turning around.
Control Mario's acceleration in the air. Note that faithful simulation of the original game is more complicated than this.
Move left and right (while not pressing down).
Set jump strength and gravity, and max speed, depending on current speed.
Keep Mario's gravity lower while the player holds the jump button.
Enter pipes, go to other levels.
Control the timer. -1 means the timer hasn't been set.
Kill the player when they fall off the bottom of the screen.
Mario gets a brief invincibility period after taking damage.
Delay for Mario moving upwards, and then down off the screen.
Move the screen to the right as Mario moves to the right.
Bounce up or create explosion on collision with the world.
Remove spawners on the current screen when entering an area.
Remove hardmode-only spawners outside of hardmode.
Spawn enemies when the screen gets close enough.
Spawn Piranha Plants in pipes (except for the first level).
Kill if Mario has a starman.
Kill if Mario has a starman.
Turn Paratroopas into Koopas and Koopas into shells if Mario Stomps
Kill other enemies as a shell.
Of course green Koopa-Troopas walk off cliffs! RED Koopas are the ones that turn around!
Step rotation 1/32nd of a full turn.
If a Goomba, stop animation and flip.
If a Koopa, change to shell and flip.
Turn around upon hitting an obstacle
Correct any error, to prevent the platform from drifting away.
Correct any error, to prevent the platform from drifting away.
It's a brick, destroy it and create rubble.
It contains a coin, give a coin and create the coin effect.
It's a multicoin block, give a coin and create the coin effect.
If this is the first hit, start the multicoin timer.
When the multicoin timer runs out, turn the block into a regular coin block.
Create the appropriate effects above a block when it is hit from below.
Move the block while it is being bumped.
Do something when the block is done moving.
Prevent the block from being used again.
Award extra lives when reaching 100 coins.
Move in a direction, reverse if it hits something.
Do palette swapping while powering up.
Palette swap while starman is active.
Slower palette swapping when starman is about to run out.
Take away invincibility and swapped colors.
Player touches the flag pole. Take complete control over the player, and make them slide down the pole.
When the flag reaches the bottom, force the player to walk right.
Turn the remaining time into points.
When the animation and the music is done, advance to the next level.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "BUT OUR PRINCESS IS IN" & newline & newline & "ANOTHER CASTLE!"

sub-events.comment: Move the brick rubble, and apply gravity.
Remove the effect and show points awarded.
